relevant_findings.general: Alert, oriented, very pleasant older woman in no acute distress.
relevant_findings.HEENT: Sclera anicteric, pupils symmetric at 3mm, mucous membranes are dry.
relevant_findings.neck: Supple, JVP not elevated, no lymphadenopathy, no thyromegaly.
relevant_findings.lungs: Minimal late inspiratory crackles at bilateral bases, no wheezing or rhonchi.
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, II/VI systolic ejection murmur at RUSB.
relevant_findings.abdomen: Soft, non-distended, RUQ tender to palpation, positive sign, no guarding or rigidity.
relevant_findings.extremities: Warm, well perfused, 2+ DP pulses, trace ankle edema, slightly worse on R leg.
relevant_findings.neurological: Alert, oriented, full and equal strength in all extremities.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient was noted to be tachypneic prior to ICU admission but was pain free and resolved nausea upon arrival.

relevant_findings.extremities: Warm, well perfused, 2+ DP pulses, trace ankle edema, slightly worse on R leg.
relevant_findings.neurological: Alert and oriented, full strength in all extremities, wearing bilateral hearing aides.
